ai.summary: A 6.1 km moderately challenging hike starting near West Dulwich Station in the UK, weaving through urban streets, parks, and woodland trails with some gentle rises.
ai.terrain_summary: Mix of urban pavements, parkland paths, and woodland tracks. Expect a few gentle ascents, occasional steps, and variable surfaces—from smooth tarmac to compact dirt. Potential mud after rain and some slippery sections in leaf litter.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for street crossings and keep to the left in busier sections. Wear sturdy boots with good grip and bring a map or offline navigation. Check weather and daylight; shorter winter days mean earlier dark. Carry water and snacks. Let someone know your route and estimated return time. In case of emergencies, have a charged phone and basic first aid kit.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layered, including a waterproof jacket)
Map and/or GPS device or offline map on phone
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of low light)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer longer daylight and milder conditions; winter hikes can be wetter and darker, requiring additional precautions.

seo.title: West Dulwich Station Hike – 6.1 km Moderate Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: A 6.1 km moderate hike starting from West Dulwich Station in the UK, combining urban paths with woodland trails. Practical tips, gear list, and safety notes.
